intro: Henriettea orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco henriettea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. Henriettea orinocensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found near streams or in dense undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
